articles.title: How to use Gradescope
articles.description: This is a guide on how to use gradescope to submit assignments.
articles.contents:
Contents
Overview
Submission process
How do I access gradescope?
How do I get help with gradescope?
Do I need to complete my assignment on a computer to submit it to gradescope?
I have complete my assignment on paper; how do I prepare it for submission to gradescope?
I have complete my assignment on the computer; how do I prepare it for submission to gradescope?
I have the file(s) with my scanned assignment; now how do I submit to gradescope?
How much time should I allow for submitting my assignment to gradescope?
How do I check my grade on an assignment?
How do I review my feedback on an assignment graded with gradescope?
How do I submit a regrade request?
Credit

Overview
This term, you will use gradescope to submit all of your homework assignments, writing assignments, the final project, and I’ll even upload your exams. Gradescope facilitates easier online grading of assignments than a simple Moodle submission. You can use gradscope to:
Submit homework online for grading .
View feedback and scores.
Make a re-grade request within prescribed guidelines.
Submission process
When you need to complete a gradescope assignment, here are a few easy steps you will take to prepare and upload your assignment, as well as to see your assignment status and grades.
Complete your assignment on paper or computer.
Save your assignment to a pdf file format.
Upload your assignment pdf file to gradescope.
How do I access gradescope?
You can click on a link to gradescope at the top of our course page. Alternatively, there is a link to gradescope on the homework page.
How do I get help with gradescope?
If you need help with your assignment instructions and/or logistics, please contact me. There are also a great wiki on using gradescope.
Do I need to complete my assignment on a computer to submit it to gradescope?
No. You can complete your assignment on paper; then you will need to scan it so you have a PDF file to submit to gradescope.
Alternatively, if you completed your assignment on a computer (e.g. using MSWord, Google docs, or LaTeX), save that file as a PDF and submit to gradescope. If you do typeset your assignment, please use proper mathematical notation.
I have complete my assignment on paper; how do I prepare it for submission to gradescope?
You can scan the pages of your assignment into a single PDF by using one of the scanners in the Libe.
–OR–
You can use a free app (available for iOS and Android devices) to take pictures that are translated into a PDF (see this guide).
I have complete my assignment on the computer; how do I prepare it for submission to gradescope?
Print to PDF or scan to PDF:
Given that you completed your homework on a computer, the best way to get a clear and legible scanned version is to “print to pdf” (or knit to PDF) and save the output as a PDF file. If that is not possible with the file format you used to complete the homework, the next best option is to print your assignment and then scan the page(s) to PDF.
I have the file(s) with my scanned assignment; now how do I submit to gradescope?
See this video or this webpage for instructions.
How much time should I allow for submitting my assignment to gradescope?
The first few times, allow an extra 10 minutes to successfully submit an assignment to gradescope. Remember that you need to create a pdf file of your assignment (i.e., scanned version) to submit.
How do I check my grade on an assignment?
I will import your marks into Moodle’s gradebook, so you will be able to see your makrs under the grades tab. See the next item How do I review my feedback… for information on how to get detailed score information and feedback on your work.
How do I review my feedback on an assignment graded with gradescope?
Once your assignment is graded and you log into gradescope via Moodle, you will see all grading rubrics, and rubric items applied to your submission will be highlighted. Click on a question name within the assignment to view the rubric items for that question and any comments. Viewing the rubric is a great way to get feedback about your work. See this page for more details.
How do I submit a regrade request?
See this webpage for details.
Credit
This guide was adapted from CMU’s guide on gradescope.

articles.title: Course resources
articles.description: Here are key course documents and resources, ranging from the syllabus to software help.
articles.contents:
Contents
Essential course information
Textbook
Software installation
Gradescope help

Essential course information
Syllabus
Schedule an appointment
Problem topic sheet
Specifications for successful work
Token spending form
Talk reflection form (Fill this out to earn a token for attending a stats/data science colloquium.)
Mistake report
Grade tracking checklist
Post questions/discuss content on Slack
Submit your assignments via Gradescope
Check your progress in Moodle’s gradebook
Textbook
The required textbook is Probability and Bayesian Modeling by Jim Albert and Monika (Jingchen) Hu (2020, CRC).
A free ebook version is available here: https://bayesball.github.io/BOOK/
Software installation
R/RStudio
We will use R/RStudio as our computational engine. Please install the current version of R and RStudio at the beginning of the term if you plan to use a local version.
Download R: https://cran.r-project.org/
Download RStudio desktop: https://www.rstudio.com/products/rstudio/download/#download
The maize server (https://maize.mathcs.carleton.edu) is also available for your use, but can only be accessed on campus of via a VPN.
JAGS
We will use JAGS (Just Another Gibbs Sampler) “automate” some of the posterior sampling via MCMC this term. Please install JAGS using prior to installing the R packages listed below.
Link to the latest version: https://sourceforge.net/projects/mcmc-jags/files/latest/download
R packages
We will use numerous R packages throughout this course. They are all installed on the maize R Studio server. If you are working on a local install, then please run the code chunk below to install all of the packages. I recommend doing this at the beginning of the course to avoid last minute installation issues preventing you from completing assignments.


install.packages(c("ProbBayes", "loo", "coda", "runjags", "MCMCpack",
                   "tidybayes", "VGAM"), dependencies = TRUE)



Gradescope help
How to use Gradescope
Gradescope student center
